intro: Faucherea ambrensis var. marojejyensis, commonly known as the Marojejy hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of the Marojejy National Park. It features palmate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
